result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:45 PM Beau Allen Merriman appears in Court,  Atty Travis Satorius, ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF99 and 22CF137 (STC). Atty Satorius would like to set a plea and sentencing. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:49 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 11:41 am.

11:36 AM Defendant Beau Allen Merriman appears in Court, Atty Travis Satorius, ADA Joseph Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF99 and 22CF137 (PH). Atty Satorius will waive the PH's.  Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service.

3:26 PM Defendant Beau Allen Merriman appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Kaitlyn Dippolito appears by phone, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for PD.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews Defendant's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $2,500.00 SIBS  on 22CF137 w/conditions of absolute sobriety &   Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service., no objection. Court so orders. Court confirms address and phone number. PH requested  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
